Unsourced material may be challenged and removed. *Find sources:* "Bedok Stadium" – news **·** newspapers **·** books **·** scholar **·** JSTOR *(December 2020)* *(Learn how and when to remove this message)* **Bedok Stadium** is a [football](/wiki/Association_football) [stadium](/wiki/Stadium) located in [Bedok](/wiki/Bedok), Singapore. It is the main home ground of [Singapore Premier League](/wiki/Singapore_Premier_League) side, [Geylang International FC](/wiki/Geylang_International_FC), and used mostly for [football](/wiki/Football_(soccer)) matches for both the [Singapore Premier League](/wiki/Singapore_Premier_League) and [Singapore National Football League](/wiki/Singapore_National_Football_League) competitions. The stadium is open daily from 4:30am till 8:30pm to the public, unless it is exclusively booked. The stadium is managed by [Sport Singapore](/wiki/Sport_Singapore). On 1 May 2011, the [People's Action Party](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party) (PAP) election rally for the [East Coast GRC](/wiki/East_Coast_GRC) during the [2011 General Election](/wiki/2011_general_election) was held at the Bedok Stadium. It was the home ground for [Geylang International FC](/wiki/Geylang_International_FC) from 1996 till 2019. ## Facilities & Structures The stadium has a [seating capacity](/wiki/Seating_capacity) of 3,964 people. (2000 permanent, 1000 semi-permanent & 800 portable). The stadium consists of a football field, an 8-lane running track and partial athletic facilities. It is also part of the Bedok Sports Complex, a community sports facility that includes Bedok Swimming Complex, Bedok Sports Hall, Bedok Fitness Centre and the Bedok Stadium itself. - [List of stadiums in Singapore](/wiki/List_of_stadiums_in_Singapore) This article about a [Singaporean](/wiki/Singapore) sports venue is a stub.
